products.name: Bar Keepers Friend Rust Cleanser & Polish Powder

extendedInfo.detail: Works great on stainless steel sinks. Stainless steel. Ceramic. Copper. Brass. Fiberglass. Corian. Chrome. Aluminum. Bathroom. Kitchen. Cookware. Outdoor. Since 1882. Once tried, always used. Can opener friendly. Recommended by: All-Clad, Build.com, Calphalon, Cutco, Dacor, Electrolux, Elkay, Franke, Formica, General electric, Kohler. Tramontina, Viking, Volrath and many others. The one that works! Follow us: Facebook; Twitter; Instagram; Pinterest; YouTube.  To read BKF user reviews - Google us. Questions or comments? 1-800-433-5818.  NSF: Nonfood compounds program listed (A1, A3 and A6). NSF Registration No. 145349.
extendedInfo.directions: Kitchen: Use BKF to clean cookware, sinks, stoves, oven doors, backsplashes, non-stone countertops, and drained-floors. BKF will make your pots & pans shine like new. Use BKF to buff-out knife marks on ceramic plates. Read note below before cleaning appliance exteriors. Bathroom: Use BKF to clean sinks, tubs, showers, faucets, toilets, tile, and grout. BKF will quickly and completely remove mineral deposits, soap scum, and rust stains. Outdoor: Use BKF to clean stainless steel grills, vinyl siding, tools, hardware, ornaments, boats, and sporting equipment. Use BKF to dean vehicle surfaces that you have first tested. (Read note below.)  Use a pail of water and sponge or hose to rinse BKF. Sprinkle onto a wet surface. Rub gently with a wet cloth or sponge. Rinse thoroughly with clean water within a minute of application, then wipe dry. See note below about testing delicate surfaces. Note: May etch or dull delicate surfaces. Test a small, hidden area first. Rub extra gently on fiberglass, plastics, anodized aluminum, and brushed metal surfaces such as appliance exteriors. Always rub in the direction of the brush lines. Do not use on: gold, silver (sterling silver is Ok), polished stone, cast iron, or surfaces that are lacquered, painted, or mirrored. Safe for septic systems.
extendedInfo.warnings: Eye irritant. Read back carefully. Contains oxalic acid, benzenesulfonic acid, mono-C10-16-alkyl derivs, sodium salts. Do not ingest, inhale, or get in eyes. If accidentally ingested, drink milk (or water) and call a doctor. If in eyes, flush eyes with clean water for 1 s minutes. Do not mix with other chemicals, such as bleach or ammonia. For prolonged use (or sensitive skin) use gloves. Do not inhale BKF dust wet BKF powder immediately after dispensing. Keep away from children. Harmful if swallowed.
